Articles.Content:
This was requested last year, but never got done for whatever reason. I had some time on my hands, so threw this together.

If anyone wants to put some screaming kerbs behind the windows, be my guest.
I thought nova made a stackable Command Pod. Also, not trying to be harsh, but that is pretty bad texture work.
is a little fugly, but the things been made and thats all that matters. its good, i did want this, its just not pretty

Yeah, fully aware of how shitty looking it is, over 9000 hours in MS Paint etc. I just had that request on my mind for some reason and the time to do it. One day I\'ll learn to model and texture properly, but I waste enough of my time as it is right now.

Feel free to retexture anyone.

I thought nova made a stackable Command Pod. Also, not trying to be harsh, but that is pretty bad texture work.

He did, but those modules are described as unmanned and/or remote controlled units, crew capacity numbers and facecams of onboard kerbals notwithstanding. They are also textured either with painted stripes or gold foil, lacking any features necessary for habitation, e.g.: hatches, windows, utility ports, etc. This module at least has that.

It\'s certainly a start. Like I tell other first-time molders, don\'t release your first mod. People will complain about it. Hell, they complain about pro mods. Kudos to you for actually making a mod. Keep up the work.

It\'s certainly a start. Like I tell other first-time molders, don\'t release your first mod. People will complain about it. Hell, they complain about pro mods. Kudos to you for actually making a mod. Keep up the work.

Yeah I made that mistake, and I think you know what happened

Thing is though, in your case you had released a 'first mod' in addition to planning on making another without notifying the creators beforehand. That is quite different compared to simply releasing a mod for the first time.
If I get bored tomorrow, I\'ll take a whack at retexturing that.

Thing is though, in your case you had released a 'first mod' in addition to planning on making another without notifying the creators beforehand. That is quite different compared to simply releasing a mod for the first time.

Then i settled that thing on the 2nd page...then it continued...

It\'s certainly a start. Like I tell other first-time molders, don\'t release your first mod. People will complain about it. Hell, they complain about pro mods. Kudos to you for actually making a mod. Keep up the work.

Since when did releasing mods become a 'bad' thing??

Since when did releasing mods become a 'bad' thing??

Only when people use others works as a base and don\'t get permission first.

Only when people use others works as a base and don\'t get permission first.

hmm makes sense
